CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, November 21, 1942, pg. 11 reads: "Women At War Drive Large Trucks Across The Country - Everywhere women are aiding in was effort. They are assuming newer responsibilities in their determination to help our men win the war against the Axis powers.  Here petite Rebecca Jefferson, of Pittsburgh, is shown standing beside the large truck which she drove from Cleveland to Pittsburgh in a test run for a local automobile firm.  She said: 'It was easy.'...Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rebecca Jefferson wearing trousers, plaid jacket, and dark cap, leaning against truck
